channel.title: Boxing or kickboxing
channel.description:
Hello, i would like to join something that involves boxing but i still don't know if i would box or kickbox. Could someone help me to make this choice? if a boxer would fight a kickboxer, who would win?
please post helpful reply's cause i really dont know wich one to choose

item.title: Boxing or kickboxing
item.dc:creator: @r4ndom1 r4ndom1
item.description:
@r4ndom1 wrote:

[quote=“Chimaera God, post:19, topic:150671”]I’ve tried out both of these kinds of fighting, unfortuneately I used these techniques in school . If you want to go for something a little faster and more technical, go for boxing. In kickboxing, which is also known as muay thai for the fanatics out there, a lot of the hitting is done and taught to use the legs, maily because your leg muscles are moe powerful than your arms, although your arms move faster. Kickboxing takes long to get the hang of, so go with boxing.

Another note: if you don’t like any of those, why don;t you consider taking a mixed matrial art like karate? There are many different forms of it, and it allows the use of most of your limbs and ground fighting, which is basically submission hold and what not.[quote author=r4ndom1 link=topic=206250.msg1816646#msg1816646 date=1192144326]

Ju Jitsu also involves hurting your apponent and they will teach you to punch correctly and kick so you kind of do both kick boxing and boxing.

[br][size=1]Posted on: October 11, 2007, 08:42:13 PM[/size][hr]By the way, I’m currently involved with Brazilian Ju Jitsu and I have not been taught anything about punching or kicking correctly. Ju Jitsu is mainly a form of wrestling. Punching and kicking are not allowed.
[/quote][/quote]

"wikipedia":

There are many variations of the art which leads to a diversity of approaches. Jujutsu schools (ryū) may utilize all forms of grappling techniques to some degree (i.e. throwing, trapping, joint locking, holds, gouging, biting, disengagements, striking, and kicking). In addition to jujutsu, many schools taught the use of weapons.

although I will admit ju jitsu is primarily grappling.

Read full topic

item.title: Boxing or kickboxing
item.dc:creator: @Gotta_Catch_Them_All Gotta Catch Them All
item.description:
@Gotta_Catch_Them_All wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:22, topic:150671”][quote author=hungry_tree link=topic=206250.msg1817850#msg1817850 date=1192194743]

No offence, but using your legs in fighting is dog.

I mean, boxing is so much more of a sport then kick boxing. Kick boxing is kind of a fagit sport.

thats just being ignorant, you cant just say that based on ur opinion. i do kick boxing and its not gay. u can just do the boxing because they teach you both at the same time. kicking is hard to learn though so you tend to better at the boxing when u start up.

but if ur just worried about sreet fight self defence like kung fu would be best
[/quote]
If I was in a fight and someone started doing kung fu I’d die… Of laughter.[/quote]

Until they fly kicked you in the throat.

Read full topic

item.title: Boxing or kickboxing
item.dc:creator: @Chimaera_God Chimaera God
item.description:
@Chimaera_God wrote:

I’ve tried out both of these kinds of fighting, unfortuneately I used these techniques in school . If you want to go for something a little faster and more technical, go for boxing. In kickboxing, which is also known as muay thai for the fanatics out there, a lot of the hitting is done and taught to use the legs, maily because your leg muscles are moe powerful than your arms, although your arms move faster. Kickboxing takes long to get the hang of, so go with boxing.

Another note: if you don’t like any of those, why don;t you consider taking a mixed matrial art like karate? There are many different forms of it, and it allows the use of most of your limbs and ground fighting, which is basically submission hold and what not.[quote author=r4ndom1 link=topic=206250.msg1816646#msg1816646 date=1192144326]

[quote author=r4ndom1 link=topic=206250.msg1814869#msg1814869 date=1192060064]
Ju Jitsu also involves hurting your apponent and they will teach you to punch correctly and kick so you kind of do both kick boxing and boxing.

[br][size=1]Posted on: October 11, 2007, 08:42:13 PM[/size][hr]By the way, I’m currently involved with Brazilian Ju Jitsu and I have not been taught anything about punching or kicking correctly. Ju Jitsu is mainly a form of wrestling. Punching and kicking are not allowed.

Read full topic

item.title: Boxing or kickboxing
item.dc:creator: @r4ndom1 r4ndom1
item.description:
@r4ndom1 wrote:

[quote=“Stoner, post:12, topic:150671”][quote author=r4ndom1 link=topic=206250.msg1814869#msg1814869 date=1192060064]
tbh both kick-boxing and boxing are too much of a sport. If you want to defend your self learn something such as karate as you use all styles of attack. A good tip is karate and judo are mainly self defence and use things such as blocks and throws more often to pin someone to the ground so they cannot hurt you etc. Ju Jitsu also involves hurting your apponent and they will teach you to punch correctly and kick so you kind of do both kick boxing and boxing. If you can only choose between those 2 though I’d say go kick boxing the majority of people you fight will be idiots and do the same punch every time. Just hook your arm around there punching arm as they swing forward so that you push there fist out the way then swing forwards starting with your clenched fist vertical then rotate it so it is horrizontal as you swing forwards and aim straight for the fleshy part of their nose if done hard enough it will break and may make a huge spray of blood like on films etc. Depending on who it is this may make them back down as a broken nose is VERY painful if they don’t you can repeat as similar technique aiming for there chin or temple both good places to hit. also if you ever end up side on to someone a good move is to spin round and lash out with a karate chop to the throat this can kill so be careful sometimes they just spit up a load of blood.
[/quote]
I appreciate it you took some time to write your reply but there are some incorrect things you mentioned in your reply.
First of all , who told you i wanted to defend myself?
Second of all, you said i should do kick boxing because the most people i fight will be idiots.This is not true, i wouldn’t even bother fighting someone who cant even throw a decent punch back.[/quote]

well generally when you dont defend yourself in a fight people beat the crap out of you… And you seem to be the same type of idiot as i was talking about(why the fuck are you on the internet?) They can probably throw a decent punch back and may be strong etc but I am talking about mental weaknesses e.g making the wrong decisions but idc. If you wan’t to go about hurting people for fun don’t bother learning a martial art might as well throw punches and just learn from beating up smaller people first.

Yz85Racer:

HEY YA! Sorry, but I laughed at Karate. Karate is for japs.

japs have learnt to munch burgers so why don’t you share some of their culture?

Read full topic

item.title: Boxing or kickboxing
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

r4ndom1:

tbh both kick-boxing and boxing are too much of a sport. If you want to defend your self learn something such as karate as you use all styles of attack. A good tip is karate and judo are mainly self defence and use things such as blocks and throws more often to pin someone to the ground so they cannot hurt you etc. Ju Jitsu also involves hurting your apponent and they will teach you to punch correctly and kick so you kind of do both kick boxing and boxing. If you can only choose between those 2 though I’d say go kick boxing the majority of people you fight will be idiots and do the same punch every time. Just hook your arm around there punching arm as they swing forward so that you push there fist out the way then swing forwards starting with your clenched fist vertical then rotate it so it is horrizontal as you swing forwards and aim straight for the fleshy part of their nose if done hard enough it will break and may make a huge spray of blood like on films etc. Depending on who it is this may make them back down as a broken nose is VERY painful if they don’t you can repeat as similar technique aiming for there chin or temple both good places to hit. also if you ever end up side on to someone a good move is to spin round and lash out with a karate chop to the throat this can kill so be careful sometimes they just spit up a load of blood.

HEY YA! Sorry, but I laughed at Karate. Karate is for japs.

Read full topic

item.title: Boxing or kickboxing
item.dc:creator: @Stoner1 Stoner
item.description:
@Stoner1 wrote:

r4ndom1:

tbh both kick-boxing and boxing are too much of a sport. If you want to defend your self learn something such as karate as you use all styles of attack. A good tip is karate and judo are mainly self defence and use things such as blocks and throws more often to pin someone to the ground so they cannot hurt you etc. Ju Jitsu also involves hurting your apponent and they will teach you to punch correctly and kick so you kind of do both kick boxing and boxing. If you can only choose between those 2 though I’d say go kick boxing the majority of people you fight will be idiots and do the same punch every time. Just hook your arm around there punching arm as they swing forward so that you push there fist out the way then swing forwards starting with your clenched fist vertical then rotate it so it is horrizontal as you swing forwards and aim straight for the fleshy part of their nose if done hard enough it will break and may make a huge spray of blood like on films etc. Depending on who it is this may make them back down as a broken nose is VERY painful if they don’t you can repeat as similar technique aiming for there chin or temple both good places to hit. also if you ever end up side on to someone a good move is to spin round and lash out with a karate chop to the throat this can kill so be careful sometimes they just spit up a load of blood.

I appreciate it you took some time to write your reply but there are some incorrect things you mentioned in your reply.
First of all , who told you i wanted to defend myself?
Second of all, you said i should do kick boxing because the most people i fight will be idiots.This is not true, i wouldn’t even bother fighting someone who cant even throw a decent punch back.

Read full topic

item.title: Boxing or kickboxing
item.dc:creator: @r4ndom1 r4ndom1
item.description:
@r4ndom1 wrote:

tbh both kick-boxing and boxing are too much of a sport. If you want to defend your self learn something such as karate as you use all styles of attack. A good tip is karate and judo are mainly self defence and use things such as blocks and throws more often to pin someone to the ground so they cannot hurt you etc. Ju Jitsu also involves hurting your apponent and they will teach you to punch correctly and kick so you kind of do both kick boxing and boxing. If you can only choose between those 2 though I’d say go kick boxing the majority of people you fight will be idiots and do the same punch every time. Just hook your arm around there punching arm as they swing forward so that you push there fist out the way then swing forwards starting with your clenched fist vertical then rotate it so it is horrizontal as you swing forwards and aim straight for the fleshy part of their nose if done hard enough it will break and may make a huge spray of blood like on films etc. Depending on who it is this may make them back down as a broken nose is VERY painful if they don’t you can repeat as similar technique aiming for there chin or temple both good places to hit. also if you ever end up side on to someone a good move is to spin round and lash out with a karate chop to the throat this can kill so be careful sometimes they just spit up a load of blood.

item.title: Boxing or kickboxing
item.dc:creator: @DigiSphere DigiSphere
item.description:
@DigiSphere wrote:

[quote=“XxKanexX, post:9, topic:150671”][quote author=DigiSphere link=topic=206250.msg1814744#msg1814744 date=1192049447]
Well personally, If your going for it as self defence sort of thing, I’d go for boxing, seriously when the fuck are you going to kick someone in the head when they are stood up when they could just grab your leg and knock seven shades of shit out of you.
[/quote]
Yes, but if you’re good you’re fast enough to either hit them first or block their attempt to grab you.
Do both, ha.[/quote]

Good point, but if they are the same size as you, it will be a bitch to try to get them to release your leg whilst balancing on one foot.

Read full topic
